markers.label: Reply-Dota-2-Reddit
markers.tooltip: Reddit bot that replied to Dota 2 game discussions with match statistics and player information. First open-source project which helped me develop a basic understanding how programming and hosting works

markers.label: Dota-2-Emoticons
markers.tooltip: Made animated flairs next to the username possible through CSS magic

markers.label: Reply-LoL-Reddit
markers.tooltip: Similar to Reply-Dota-2-Reddit but adapted for League of Legends subreddit

markers.label: Cubify-Reddit
markers.tooltip: After almost 4 months my Reddit bot gained 100k comment karma through shitposting cubed words

markers.label: discord-twitter-bot
markers.tooltip: Highest starred (350‚≠ê+) project: Tweets were posted to Discord. Enabled Docker support, Heroku one-click deployment, wrote a docs page, added many configuration: filtering, location boxes, ...

markers.label: pasteview
markers.tooltip: Web application for reading pastebin snippets, learned web development a bit more

markers.label: pasteindex
markers.tooltip: Created a REST API with documentation, authentication, database, etc. for maintaining pastebin codes

markers.label: discord-logo
markers.tooltip: Inspired by Github Corners I created my own idea of it: Code generation, customizable colors, customizable template (normal, corner or speech bubble), animation, eyes

markers.label: discord-logo PR
markers.tooltip: PR: Contribution by srmcgann: added customizable background animation

markers.label: discord-logo PR
markers.tooltip: PR: (Hacktoberfest) Contribution by xanaDev and zurda: remove background and added linting

markers.label: discord-logo PR
markers.tooltip: PR: Contribution by srmcgann: re-added background animation, broke in 2020 due to browser breaking changes

markers.label: dev-tracker-reddit
markers.tooltip: Reddit bot: comments by certain individuals are highlighted, e.g. game developer

markers.label: tracker-reddit-discord
markers.tooltip: Discord+Reddit bot: Reddit comments by certain individuals are posted to Discord

markers.label: discord-web-bridge
markers.tooltip: Communication bridge between discord bot <-> crossbar <-> custom webclient, started this project in my free time while I was a research assistent

markers.label: crosku
markers.tooltip: Crossbar one-click deployment on Heroku

markers.label: Red-kun
markers.tooltip: Part of a much bigger project: github.com/Cog-Creators/Red-DiscordBot. Red-DiscordBot is a modular Discord Bot which allows you to install custom cogs during runtime. I've installed 3rd party cogs and developed my own to manage Discord communities

markers.label: Professional Work Life
markers.tooltip: Transitioned from hobby projects to professional software development.

markers.label: Artificial Intelligence
markers.tooltip: Decided to focus on AI-related projects and learning.

markers.label: d-zone PR
markers.tooltip: Added Heroku one-click deployment support to d-zone project

markers.label: d-zone PR
markers.tooltip: Implemented Docker containerization for easier deployment

markers.label: d-zone forked
markers.tooltip: In the further future I forked the webclient part of d-zone. It is based on this version.

markers.label: d-zone
markers.tooltip: Major changes: commonjs -> esm, websocket URL fallback strategy, Discord OAuth2 support, CI versioned deployment, e2e testing with Playwright, Allure and Vercel deployment.

markers.label: d-back
markers.tooltip: Handles the backend logic of d-zone, meant to be installed as a python module (published as PyPI module), supports a wide variety of versions. Provides mock data when the callbacks are not registered

markers.label: d-cogs d-zone integration
markers.tooltip: Implementation of the python module d-back and thus provides real data. d-cogs makes use of Red-DiscordBot modular design and is installed as a plugin.

markers.label: d-cogs LLM integration
markers.tooltip: Built upon LangChain ü¶úüîó added different agents (conversation, classifier, mermaid, ...). Managed conversation, tool registration and tool usage. Support Ollama and OpenRouter as LLM Providers, qdrant as vector storage.

markers.label: d-flows
markers.tooltip: Re-usable workflows, mainly for Discord

markers.label: lanyard-mcp-server
markers.tooltip: Learned about Docker MCP Tools Registry: Creation of a MCP Server for integration into Agents.

markers.label: voidpet
markers.tooltip: Due to a no-link-sharing rule, this project was short-lived - born and died on the same day, 2025-12-02. It contains only a simple tier list, created as part of my first experiment with Svelte.

markers.label: GitTinkerer
markers.tooltip: GitTinkerer, Comment-to-Code Automation, implements a non-interactive, comment-triggered automation flow that turns a PR comment (or a comment submitted via a Svelte web UI) into code changes using the Codex CLI, then commits and pushes the result back to the target branch.

markers.label: Tinkero
markers.tooltip:
Self-hosted static site deployment platform with automatic builds, zero-downtime deployments, and full observability.

Tinkero is a self-hosted platform that automatically builds and deploys static sites from GitHub repositories. Push your code, and Tinkero handles the rest - building, deploying, and serving your sites behind the central lair.nntin.xyz infrastructure.

markers.label: lair.nntin.xyz
markers.tooltip: lair.nntin.xyz is the central domain for my online-facing projects.

markers.label: nntin-labs
markers.tooltip: installation and maintenance of authentik, dozzle, n8n, ollama, open-webui, portainer, etc.
